sen.j: 「上巳」は上旬の巳の日の意味であり、元々は3月上旬の巳の日であったが、古来中国の三国時代の魏 (三国)より3月3日に行われるようになったと言われている。
sen.e: The term "Joshi" or "Jomi" means the day of Serpent (the sixth sign of Chinese zodiac) in the beginning of a month, and it had originally indicated the day of Serpent in March, but it is reported that, after the Wei dynasty (Three States Period) in ancient China, the Joshi Festival became celebrated on March 3.
